answers.answer: I thought it might be helpful paste t he whole report, so here it goes:Comp. Metabolic Panel (14)Test	Low	Normal	High	Reference Range	UnitsAlt (Sgpt)		14		0-32	IU/LAlkaline Phosphatase, S		104		39-117	IU/LBilirubin, Total		0.2		0.0-1.2	mg/dLA/G Ratio		1.4		1.1-2.5	1Globulin, Total		3.0		1.5-4.5	g/dLAlbumin, Serum		4.2		3.5-5.5	g/dLProtein, Total, Serum		7.2		6.0-8.5	g/dLCalcium, Serum		9.3		8.7-10.2	mg/dLCarbon Dioxide, Total		21		19-28	mmol/LChloride, Serum	93			97-108	mmol/LPotassium, Serum		4.6		3.5-5.2	mmol/LBun/Creatinine Ratio	7			8-20	1Egfr If Africn Am		127		 >59	mL/min/1.73Egfr If Nonafricn Am		110		 >59	mL/min/1.73Creatinine, Serum		0.69		0.57-1.00	mg/dLBun	5			6-20	mg/dLAst (Sgot)		29		0-40	IU/LSodium, Serum		134		134-144	mmol/LGlucose, Serum	56			65-99	mg/dLCbc With Differential/PlateletTest	Low	Normal	High	Reference Range	UnitsWbc	3.3			3.4-10.8	x10E3/uLRbc		4.85		3.77-5.28	x10E6/uLHemoglobin		14.1		11.1-15.9	g/dLHematocrit		41.9		34.0-46.6	%Mcv		86		79-97	fLMch		29.1		26.6-33.0	pgMchc		33.7		31.5-35.7	g/dLRdw			15.7	12.3-15.4	%Platelets		177		155-379	x10E3/uLNeutrophils		41		40-74	%Lymphs		38		14-46	%Monocytes			16	4-12	%Eos		4		0-5	%Basos		1		0-3	%Neutrophils (Absolute)		1.4		1.4-7.0	x10E3/uLLymphs (Absolute)		1.2		0.7-3.1	x10E3/uLMonocytes(Absolute)		0.5		0.1-0.9	x10E3/uLEos (Absolute)		0.1		0.0-0.4	x10E3/uLBaso (Absolute)		0.0		0.0-0.2	x10E3/uLImmature Granulocytes		0		0-2	%Immature Grans (Abs)		0.0		0.0-0.1	x10E3/uL

An increased percentage of monocytes may be due to chronic infections, autoimmune disorders, blood disorders, cancers.Elevated RDW and normal MCV is associated early iron, vitamin B12, or folate deficiency; sickle cell disease; chronic liver disease; myelodysplastic syndrome.Low WBC causes include aplastic anaemia; myelodysplastic syndromes; various medications; leukemia; liver disease (hepatitis, cirrhosis, and liver failure); overactive spleen; rheumatoid arthritis; systemic lupus erythematosus; infections, vitamin deficiency.Lower than normal blood glucose levels (hypoglycemia) may be due to hypopituitarism; hypothyroidism; too little food; too much insulin or other diabetic medications; insulinoma (very rare).Low BUN-to-creatinine ratio may be due to a low protein diet; malnutrition; severe liver damage; rhabdomyolysis; pregnancy; syndrome of inappropriate antidiuretic hormone secretion (SIADH).Hypochloremia (low chloride) can be caused by loss of body fluids from prolonged vomiting, diarrhea, sweating or high fevers; drugs such as bicarbonate, corticosteroids, diuretics, laxatives; inappropriate antidiuretic hormone secretion (SIADH); metabolic alkalosis; respiratory acidosis; Addison's disease; heart failure.

Thank you for the answers, I'm so glad I found this forum :)I do have Hep. B Inactive, according to CT I have an elongated right lobe of the liver (maybe why my BUN-creatinine is low?)I don't take any meds. except Tylenol for these constant headaches.What about all the other symptoms?

Also did that Myxedema pinch test and I couldn't pinch anything skin on either arm. As an experiment I pinch my sons arm and well as my hubby's best friend and I could pinch theirs easily. And the skin on their arms feels way different then mine, it really weird.

There's not really a whole lot to go, here... except the symptoms, which can apply to both, diabetes and hyperthyroidism, as well as hypothyroidism or a number of other conditions.The diarrhea could have been a hyperthyroid thing, with the bleeding secondary from the prolonged diarrhea.  I can't imagine that your doctor didn't pull a thyroid panel (TSH, Free T3, Free T4, as well as antibodies TPOab, TgAb and TSI), as well a diabetic panel (fasting blood glucose, hemoglobin A1c, urinalysis, including ketones and protein levels) right off the bat.  Of course, you had all that pepsi on the way there, so there was no way to get a fasting blood glucose... next time - nothing but water on the way to the doctor or the lab.Monocytes are a type of white blood cell and elevated levels indicates inflammation/infection somewhere..RDW indicates the size of your red blood cells and is often elevated with low vitamin B-12 levels.  Get that checked.I can't imagine putting nothing in my stomach besides Pepsi... There's something about 3 pepsi's not spiking blood sugar that doesn't sound right, but we'll leave that for the time being.Did you get the thyroid panel?  If so, please post those results, with reference ranges, which vary lab to lab and have to come from your own report.  That's the only way we can know if your symptoms are caused by thyroid, since there are other causes for those symptoms.Hypoglycemia is low blood sugar, which is the opposite of diabetes, but like diabetes, one should avoid sugar and other things that spike blood glucose levels, which in turn spikes insulin levels and causes one to have low blood sugar, again.  It becomes a never ending roller coaster.Until I see the thyroid tests, I'm going to think that maybe you have more than one problem and maybe they're all tied in with your eating habits.

I like that myxedema pinch test. I've yet to find this test positive in anyone other than my mother (who has Hashimoto's thyroiditis) and myself and I've pinched a lot of people lol.I had internal tremors from a few conditions and they all have their own frequency so I know what it's from. Magnesium deficiency, hypothyroidism, metabolic acidosis. I've had excessive thirst since forever and only realised since I'm not drinking anywhere near as much it was due to insulin resistance as well as magnesium deficiency.Hypoglycemia can be due to insulin resistance (precusor to diabetes) but in my case no labs showed this until I had my actual insulin levels measured. In my case, high insulin really suppressed my appetite. And when I had hyperthyroidism, this worsened my insulin resistance and I also developed impaired glucose intolerance (pre diabetes) due to too much thyroid hormone messing with the pancreas (or something lol).

Thank you for the reply and the help. I went to the lab the 26th the tech. said 2-4 business days for test results. I've since gotten rid of my doc. and found one that has a sparkling rep. with his patients. The test the lab did was Full Thyroid Panel (not sure which one), Hemoglobin A1c (even though she said she ruled out Diabetes), Hepatitus, Cholesterol and HIV. So I should have my results no later then Tuesday (fingers crossed). I promise to post them as soon as I get them. And I'm doing much better in my diet since I got all these symptoms but still struggling with what to do when I just can't eat (I have Bi-polar and it affects my appetite).

I like the pinch test as well, now I want to go around pinching everyone (hope I don't lose any friends over this)...LOL! Hubbby will be home soon, he's the next to get pinched..ha ha. My son and friend said the skin on my upper arms feel thick and not pliable like theirs is and I have to agree. It's like I have super thick skin...strange I never noticed it before. For all the problems you mentioned above how did find all this out? I know about an endo. thyroid but do they do things like check for things you mentioned or was there another specialist or just your PCP? Hope you're doing better since finding out what was wrong. I'm really looking forward to see these results so I can finally find out what's wrong with me. I'll keep you all posted.

I'm glad you went ahead and got the labs, particularly, the thyroid panel.  Do you know if Free T3 and Free T4 were ordered, as well as TSH.  What about the antibody tests?  I'm also glad you goth A1c test... doesn't sound to me like your previous doctor ruled out much of anything.  I don't mean to pry, but is there a particular reason you would have done Hepatitus (which one?) and HIV?Depression is a symptom of thyroid issues and many people with hyperthyroidism, have been diagnosed with Bi-polar, when that's not what they have.  I used to go through periods when I couldn't eat either, even though I knew I should.  During those times, I'd, at least, nibble on a cracker or slice of toast, just to get something in my stomach.  After a while, I'd eventually be able to eat "semi-normally", until it hit again.Looking forward to seeing those lab results.

All the lab script said was thyroid full panel, so I won't know till the tests come back. As well it only said hepatitis so again I won't know till test comes back.  I'm sure she doing that test because I've had hep. B inactive since I was 19 and I've never had it monitored, no one said I should. As for the HIV test not really sure why she's ordering that... She simply asked me when the last time I was tested and I said 3yrs ago when I had my last child.

If you had active Hep B at age 19, you could still have the virus, but it's unlikely; most likely your body developed the antibodies and once you have those, you can't get it again.  I've been through the vaccines twice, because of my job and I didn't develop the antibodies... I'm still susceptible to the disease; you wouldn't be.I can't wait to see that lab report...

I had to research on google as none of my doctors could figure it out. You can request tests that you think you might need from your doctor though. I had to fight sometimes to get the tests I wanted and some were normal and some were very abnormal. Good thing I didn't have to pay for any of them. :)

While we can request tests we want, our doctors often refuse to order them, if they don't think they are relevant AND while insurance may pay for some of them, it doesn't always pay for all of them, so we could often get stuck with a very hefty lab bill.   We don't have a national health care system here, so it pays to be prudent in what we ask for and make sure it's covered by insurance before agreeing to get it done.

Thanks to both of of you for all your helpful information. I agree about asking for tests you want to have done, especially if you still feel like there's other issues that have not been addressed. I went in to the docs. with a print out about Thyroid (the types and symptoms). as well as Diabetes (types and symptoms) and circled all of my symptoms. She didn't even want to go over them with me :( But thank god she agreed to the tests anyway. I hope my new doc. is better then this one, just wish I could see him sooner then the 15th.

Can someone take a look back over my test above and let me know if you think of any kind of supplements I could benefit from. I'm currently not taking anything and I thought maybe a some supp. would help me feel a little  better. Also is there anything you suggest I stay away from? Thanks a bunch for all your support.

The biggest thing I'd recommend is a healthy diet, including plenty of protein, veggies and healthy fats.  You need to have solid food in your stomach and getting your nutrition from fresh food is much better than getting it from supplements.  The only thing I might suggest would be Vitamin B12, but I'd prefer that you get that tested, prior to supplementing, in order to be sure you're supplementing the right thing.Unfortunately, many doctors don't want to take time to go over print outs, etc, because they think they can cover all the bases without the patient's help; however, we patients have to be our own advocates.  The trick is to not take too much stuff for the doctor to look at.You've had the blood drawn, if the right tests were ordered, those results will tell which direction to go.

Thanks again... I will wait for the results before getting any supps. Funny you mention b12, I had a friend that I saw daily and he took vitamins everyday. He started giving me a  b12 vitamin everyday and I noticed that I felt a little better. I'll try to get the new doctor to test for that.

Got my labs back and need some advice...I don't know if this means anything but at the top of my lab results it says Client Note: ^NONFASTING although I didn't eat for more then 12hrs.So I'm not really sure what to think of these results...Lipid Panel with LDL/HDL RatioCholesterol, Total 203mg   Range 100-199Triglycerides 45mg   Range 0-149HDL Cholesterol 91mg   Range >39VLDL Cholesterol, Cal 9mg   Range 5-40LDL Cholesterol Calc 103mg   Range 0-99LDL/HDL Ratio 1.1   Range 0.0-3.2Thyroid Panel with TSHTSH 0.930ulU/mL   Range   0.450-4.500Thyroxine (T4) 6.8ug/dL   Range 4.5-12.0T3 Uptake 30%   Range   24-39Free Thyroxine Index 2.0   Range 1.2-4.9Hepatitis Panel (4)Hep A Ab, IgM  NegativeHepBsAg Screen  PositiveHep B Core Ab, ImM  NegativeHep C Virus Ab  <0.1   Range 0.0-0.9 (Negative)Hemaglobin A1c 5.5%   Range 4.8-5.6Could use some help understanding what this all means...thanks so much everyone.
Barb and Red you there?

Just got this test today...was not even worried about the results to this one.Test	                           Low	Normal	High	Reference Range	UnitsHiv 1/O/2 Abs, Qual		Non Reactive		Non ReactiveHiv 1/O/2 Abs-Index Value		<1.00		<1.00

question: I'm 39 years old, female, 118lbs and 5' 9". Let me tell you a little bit about what's been going on with me and hopefully I can get some of you to give me your honest opinion. Sorry this is so long but I'm trying to be as through as possible, thanks for reading  :)For the last couple of years I've been having these bouts which consist of fatigue, whole body tremors, weakness, excessive thirst, sweating (for no reason) also night sweats, waking in the middle of the night, rapid heart rate, loose stools and my menstrual cycle stopped a year ago. These symptoms come and go and vary from moderate to not being able to get out of bed. My family (hubby and kids) and some of my friends seem to think this is all caused by my poor eating habits ( sometimes one meal a day) and I will agree that this is not a good way to eat. I do notice that when these symptoms come on and I eat something sweet (ie Nature Valley Peanut Butter Chewy Granola Bar and a glass of Pepsi) within an hour my symptoms start to go away but I never really feel quite right.Then the hammer fell at the beginning of this month, 6/1/14 to be exact. I woke up to the worst GI pain I think I've ever had, I almost didn't make it to the bathroom  :blink:. For two days I was in and out of the bathroom every 5-15 min. with worst smelling GI's I've ever had. Day three and I noticed the blood on the tissue, by afternoon it was visibly in the toilet as well  :o and my bouts (described above) were getting worse and more frequent. I started getting headaches all the time, some lasting all day. And then this past Sunday I woke in the middle of the night and couldn't open my eyes. It felt like someone taped sandpaper under my eye lids and I had a large amount of yellow goop in my left eye. Since then my eyes have been very dry and every time I wake up they're so dry it's hard to open them and focus. Needless to say i was scared at this point so I called my insurance and spoke with an on call nurse, she recommended I see my doc. ASAP. I made an appointment but in the meantime I started speaking with family members about any health issues within the family. Here's what I found out (some I already knew about)...My two sisters (my only siblings) both diagnosed with Graves Disease, one has low blood sugar but not DiabetesSisters daughter (20yrs) just had routine blood drawn and showed elevated TSH, will know more with further testing.Mothers side:Aunt J has Type 2 Diabetes, Cholesterol, 4 heart stintsMother has Type 2 Diabetes and HypoCousin K had Thyroid CancerCousin M has Breast CancerUncles J & T had Prostate CancerGrandpa died of Prostate CancerFathers side:Father died of heart failure, he also had Diabetes (type unknown)Aunt M Diabetes (type unknown)Aunt M died of heart failureWhen I saw my doc. (she's a new one btw) she took blood and a urine test. She said my symptoms were probably because of my eating habits and that I had pink eye (she gave me a script, I refuse to take it, no one blames me for it either). Now I don't know about anyone else but I've seen a lot of pink eye in my day with having kids and all but there is NO WAY on this earth that I have pink eye and no one else I know believes her either. So she orders me to go get an Abdominal CT Scan done stat and to make an appt. with a GI doc.Finally got in to see GI doc. on Thursday 6/19 and he orders me to have a Colonoscopy on Monday 6/23...he said I could eat all day Saturday till 12:00am but nothing after that, till after my test. Sunday I couldn't make it, almost passed out and my hubby agreed that i needed to eat and that I would just have to reschedule. When GI office called me Monday I declined to reschedule until I went back my doc. to have her run more test before I do anything else. Made appt. to see her for Wed. 6/25.I grab my CT Scan results from the radiology lab to see what they found. Several parts of my colon had inflammation and/or thickening and I had an elongated right lobe of the liver.Mean while my sisters both firmly believe that I have Graves Disease at this point and suggest I ask my doc. to give me a Full Thyroid Panel. And are further angered by the fact that she didn't do a test before knowing my family history.6/25 appt: I explain what happened to me over the weekend but she insist that I reschedule my colonoscopy stat, I said not until you run more test because something is seriously wrong with me. I repeated my family history and requested a Full Thyroid Panel, she agreed. I also asked to be tested for Diabetes, she said she ruled that out already (I was relieved) but not for long (more to come). So she hands me a script for the lab which I had to fast overnight for, so I went the next morning.The more to come...So I signed up that day for my doc., the local hospital and the labs "Patient Portal" so I could start being more proactive in my health care. When I get back from the lab the next day I got an email saying my results are in. ???? I just got back, so I signed in and low and behold it's my labs from the first visit with her on 6/5, so I start going through it and noticed some issues. I will note anything NOT within range...Test was taken after I had consumed 2 glasses of Pepsi at home and one bottle of Pepsi on the way to and in the office, so all drank within 1 1/2 hour before this test. Nothing to eat that morning yet.Monocytes 16%  range 4-12%RDW 15.7%  range 12.3-15.4%WBC 3.3  range 3.4-10.8Glucose Serum 56mg  range 65-99mgBun/Creatinine Ratio 7  range 8-20Chloride, Serum 93mmol  range 97-108mmolI have since switched doctors because I really feel like this women should have called me with these result and had me come in sooner for more testing, esp. with my family history. I can't help but wonder what my Glucose level would have been had I not drank those sodas... Guess I'll have to wait till I see my new doc. on the July 15th or I can see them through the lab patient portal.Well thanks for listening to me and being patient enough to get to the end, I really appreciate it. Any advice would be so very welcome and also much appreciated.  :)QuoteMultiQuoteEdit
title: Could this be a thyroid and/or Diabetes issue?
